class PhysicsManager

Detailed Description

This class is used to define area's in the world that have unique effects.

Common uses for this class are for gravity fields, and explosions. But can be made to do more.
Note: This is a base class intended to be derived from. This class cannot be created itself. To make an AreaEffect class that does what you want it to, simple inherit from this class with an AE class of your own, and define the ApplyEffect() function to do what you want your effect to do.

Member Function Documentation

virtual void phys::AreaEffect::ApplyEffect (  )  [pure virtual]

Defines and applies the effect of the field.

When inheriting this class, this function is what defines the effect the field has.
This function will be called on by the physics manager and shouldn't be called manually.

Implemented in phys::TestAE, phys::GravityField, and phys::GravityWell.

void phys::AreaEffect::CreateBoxShape ( const Vector3  HalfExtents  ) 

Creates a Box shape for the field.

When making the vector to be passed in, remember to pass in only half values of what you want the actual size to be.

Parameters:
HalfExtents The vector representing the size of the shape.

Definition at line 229 of file areaeffect.cpp.

void phys::AreaEffect::CreateCylinderShapeX ( const Vector3  HalfExtents  ) 

Creates a Cylinder shape for the field that is alligned on the X axis.

When making the vector to be passed in, remember the layout should be as such: (width*0.5, radius, radius), with the second radius perpendicular to the first.

Parameters:
HalfExtents The vector representing the size of the shape.

Definition at line 208 of file areaeffect.cpp.

void phys::AreaEffect::CreateCylinderShapeY ( const Vector3  HalfExtents  ) 

Creates a Cylinder shape for the field that is alligned on the Y axis.

When making the vector to be passed in, remember the layout should be as such: (radius, height*0.5, radius), with the second radius perpendicular to the first.

Parameters:
HalfExtents The vector representing the size of the shape.

Definition at line 215 of file areaeffect.cpp.

void phys::AreaEffect::CreateCylinderShapeZ ( const Vector3  HalfExtents  ) 

Creates a Cylinder shape for the field that is alligned on the Z axis.

When making the vector to be passed in, remember the layout should be as such: (radius, radius, length*0.5), with the second radius perpendicular to the first.

Parameters:
HalfExtents The vector representing the size of the shape.

Definition at line 392 of file areaeffect.cpp.

void phys::AreaEffect::CreateGraphicsSphere ( const ColourValue &  Colour,
const Whole  Rings = 16,
const Whole  Segments = 16 
) [virtual]

Creates a sphere mesh based on the physics shape for this area effect.

This function will create a material script on the fly for you to use with your AR field.

Parameters:
Colour The colour to put into the custom created material script. This will be the final colour of the graphics object.
Rings The number of horizontal rings the sphere is to be comprised of. This along with the segments parameter controls the overall resolution of the sphere. Less then 16 is not recommended.
Segments The number of vertical rings the sphere is to be comprised of. This along with the rings parameter controls the overall resolution of the sphere. Less then 16 is not recommended.

Definition at line 354 of file areaeffect.cpp.

void phys::AreaEffect::CreateGraphicsSphere ( String &  MaterialName,
const Whole  Rings = 16,
const Whole  Segments = 16 
) [virtual]

Creates a sphere mesh based on the physics shape for this area effect.

Parameters:
MaterialName The name of the material script to be applied to the graphics object that is created. Must be valid.
Rings The number of horizontal rings the sphere is to be comprised of. This along with the segments parameter controls the overall resolution of the sphere. Less then 16 is not recommended.
Segments The number of vertical rings the sphere is to be comprised of. This along with the rings parameter controls the overall resolution of the sphere. Less then 16 is not recommended.

Vector3 phys::AreaEffect::GetLocation (  ) 

Gets the origin for the area effect.

This function is particularly useful when making fields such as gravity wells, that have continuous effects centering on one location.

Returns:
Returns the vector3 representing the location of the area effect.

void phys::AreaEffect::ScaleFieldShape ( const Vector3  Scale  ) 

Sets the scale of the shape of the field.

The default scale is 1.0.

Parameters:
Scale The vector3 representing the scale you wish to apply to each axis of the field shape.

Definition at line 320 of file areaeffect.cpp.

void phys::AreaEffect::SetLocation ( const Vector3  Location  ) 

Sets the origin for the area effect.

In most cases you won't want to call this, with the exception of when you want a field to follow/track an actor.

Parameters:
Location The updated location of the origin for the field.

Definition at line 331 of file areaeffect.cpp.

void phys::AreaEffect::UpdateActorList (  )  [virtual]

Updates the actors listed as within the field.

This function is automatically called once every simulation step. This shouldn't be called manually unless your usage of this class requires more then one update per step.
